page.title: 19Attitudes-Dorking NE
page.content: We asked a number of people who we saw if they had any particular worries about life today. One elderly resident of Pinehurst Old Peoples Home said:- "I am worried about{violence}at football matches." Another said:- "It is at home where the violence starts,because the parents are not strict enough." A third said:- "People are not as polite today as they were when I was young." There were local worries of{heavy {lorries}on narrow lanes;ancient hedges and{footpaths}being dug up and change in the atmosphere of a pub caused by the policy of new chain management.The imminent opening of the{M25}caused concern to the pub's owner who might lose{business}and a Managing Director who thought the town might become a tourist attraction and{too busy.
